intro: Psathyrotes schottii, commonly known as the Schott's starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to parts of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, this plant thrives in moist, temperate climates. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of streams. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
